text:
CVS can't found repository path on Windows based CVS (CVSNT)

QUOTE:
      [cvs] cvs checkout: CVSROOT requires a path spec:
      [cvs] cvs checkout: :(gserver|kserver|pserver):[[user][:password]@]host[:
[port]]/path
      [cvs] cvs checkout: [:(ext|server):][[user]@]host[:]/path
      [cvs] cvs [checkout aborted]: Bad CVSROOT: 
`:pserver:xxxxx:xxxxxx@xxxxxx:c:\var\cvsroot'.


I tried using diferent ways like: /c/var/cvsroot, /var/cvsroot, c\var\cvsroot. 

QUOTE:
   [cvs] /c/var/cvsroot: no such repository
creator: dahool@underbox.com.ar
stevel@apache.org
text:
I dont see this as an Ant problem; it looks to me like CVS NT configuration. 

See http://www.cvsnt.org/pipermail/cvsnt/2004-May/012591.html
and http://www.pushok.com/help/cvsscc/index.php?redirect=inst_plugin_win.htm
and http://www.cvsnt.org/wiki/InstallationTips
Filing as invalid. it would fail on the command line, too.
